A581B95842B64FDE9B14243D32FB2E11.description: Discuss a plan for obtaining one’s dream job in the food service industry.

FBEF089836CA4C69817D0C6BAECBEFF8.description: Communicate research findings related to occupations in the food service industry through a display, brochure, video, presentation software, website or an oral presentation.

13B97E274E684F2D944F8A489E65A670.description: Discuss apprenticeship, including its advantages and disadvantages, as a pathway to a career in the food service industry.

40E4CB1F58FB4A11BB6AAE9E2694874A.description: Reflect upon personal suitability or non-suitability for a specific occupation in the food service industry, considering criteria such as: initial and continuing educational and training requirements; duties and skills required for this occupation; work environment, including typical hours and shifts work and typical locations; current wages received in Saskatchewan and how these compare to the rest of Canada; physical, mental and emotional stresses related to this occupation; workplace hazards and safety considerations; other occupations with which they interact; apprenticeship and/or certification requirements in Canada and Saskatchewan; and, future trends impacting the trade.

6A33402890F64C49A931C0C66486EE76.description: Create a list of personal interests, skills and traits that may lead to a career in the food service industry.

95A849A5182A472D8890DF21D960699E.description: Identify career opportunities in the food service industry in one’s community.

1485F933A82C4C668C41B2B059F7EE17.description: Investigate career opportunities in the food service industry.

05D9508A616749AF8F23223D4598BE2E.description: Explain the purpose of instructional and standardized recipes.

6E70BBF6371F48AF9A10F7A653CB2783.description: Examine the purpose and components of recipes.

7DC1A1E14B88488895ECA313EB32286C.description: Demonstrate safe use practices and precautions identified by the manufacturer for the use, maintenance and storage of kitchen tools, appliances and equipment.

6926253788FF4AE09F21E0AA49F8949C.description: Discuss the processes for cleaning and maintaining commercial kitchen equipment (e.g., refrigerator, freezer, dishwasher, deep-fryer and vents).

5C853DC797CD4EC28F7A4ACCAC0656C3.description: Determine the appropriate tools, appliances and equipment for specific tasks.

8AE4EE1B047D42738E0E6BE7230E9CA6.description: Clean and maintain tools and equipment using appropriate techniques and materials.

C835EECF003642BEBB4FE5D80B64843A.description: Demonstrate proper use, including safety practices, of industrial equipment in commercial kitchens.

AE46026FD3124AF2869FBC9976EFCA95.description: Identify industrial equipment (e.g., stand mixers, food processors, griddles, dishwashers and portable cooktops) used in commercial kitchens.

1A903482C7934961B7CF05217CCC1533.description: Use small appliances safely and appropriately.

DC811C82A4F8461386C66E49ADF4669C.description: Identify the purpose of small appliances (e.g., hand mixers and blenders) in a commercial kitchen.

05A50B41375041AFAE555FAC0C530572.description: Examine design and function of common kitchen tools (e.g., spatulas, knives, vegetable peelers, spoons, measuring cups, thermometers, whisks and whips) and equipment (e.g., colanders, mixing bowls and cookware).

CC0AD33CE7744F779363F8036F91BB98.description: Discuss the kinds of tools and equipment typically used in a commercial kitchen.

1E9EFC0D415E4996B45DB193C518EA23.description: Demonstrate safe and appropriate use of kitchen tools and equipment in a commercial kitchen.

363291274B934E8790067D0937C273F4.description: Maintain and properly store tools and equipment.

3812850A9508434ABFBA0A35FD27020F.description: Examine the role of bake shop ingredients in a recipe.

79908F55F662485DBE6026A3C1336484.description: Identify the variety of bake shop ingredients, including: types of flour (e.g., bread, cake, pastry, rye and whole wheat); sugars and sweeteners (e.g., agave, brown, confectioner’s, granulated, molasses and Turbinado); fats (e.g., butters, oils and shortenings); eggs (e.g., fresh and frozen); milks (e.g., liquids, dried and non-dairy substitutes); thickening agents (e.g., arrowroot, cornstarch, flours and gelatin sheets); yeasts (e.g., active dry, compressed, instant, yeast starters and their activation temperatures); and, flavourings (e.g., chocolate, extracts, emulsions, salts and seeds).

16EE6A3187DA43C6A7EA6951A974E15A.description: Discuss the appropriate baking tools for a variety of baking tasks.

AD59CE6AAA4D48D0B98401E2F88F76D0.description: Examine the design and function of essential baking tools and equipment.

11E3FF3D7E22480DB7262815DDB13E13.description: Identify tools and equipment (e.g., baker’s scales, pastry bags and tips, silicone baking mats, palette knives, bench mixers and proofing cabinets) required for baking.

97AF3C9B482A4722A34FD52576745ADE.description: Examine a variety of tools, equipment and ingredients essential for baking.

EA755168B653461BB907424A4FE5EB39.description: Measure ingredients using liquid, dry and displacement methods.

2A2F432C36984263A1C3697C95EB4375.description: Convert recipe measurements from imperial to metric (e.g., teaspoon to millilitres and pounds to grams) and metric to imperial.

93C08EF2CA3042D88A7A0950AAAA40F3.description: Differentiate between imperial and metric systems of measurement.

18AC346799B74E58873E79A0DFA28F7C.description: Identify measurement tools (e.g., measuring spoons, measuring cups, thermometers and kitchen scales) common to a commercial kitchen.

BB2BC989402D4CDDB902D86BFC3B88E3.description: Describe measurements traditionally used in commercial cooking including weight (e.g., As purchased – AP and Edible portion – EP), volume, count, dry and wet measurement.

B2A8F963D5CC4311B261E18343BE23E0.description: Identify measurements (e.g., weight, volume and count) common to the commercial cooking.

F32407E06FF946B994FEABED55AF5A04.description: Demonstrate appropriate measurement techniques used in commercial cooking.

004F48FEC73348B0923585EB9B6D8083.description: Demonstrate appropriate food safety standards when receiving, selecting, handling, preparing, serving and storing food.

71E5D34772814E9BB5E0D6D0D9319272.description: Discuss the role of municipal, provincial and national food safety legislation and regulations.

69CE37E7E19A4E3D955C965BBE42D37F.description: Examine safe and sanitary practices to dispose of kitchen waste.

9BCFEECB84464147B098E44A9DFF0C90.description: Explain the importance of kitchen sanitation and personal hygiene in the prevention of food contamination and food-borne illnesses.

24D944F0FB624BA690A39DE7A33F8E5E.description: Differentiate date labelling (e.g., best-before, packaged on and expiration) on pre-packaged foods.

8A36842D64E34562AC02AD5148E1FCA2.description: Discuss common food safety steps (e.g., clean, separate, cook and chill) to reduce food contamination.

143FEBF2B3664647A686DAAF26B5FF2F.description: Differentiate between direct contamination and cross-contamination.

333F20E470C942FC84C239A9C2CDFA93.description: Identify causes of food-borne illnesses (e.g., food poisoning and food allergies).

E93F614B4E684CCEA37301D1AB66A582.description: List examples of biological (e.g., bacteria and viruses), chemical (e.g., cleaners and disinfectants) and physical (e.g., glass or metal fragments) contaminants.

74F407E22D8947DE80C36EFD89A2FA4C.description: Identify the causes of food contamination (e.g., biological, chemical and physical) that can occur in a commercial kitchen.

C6332EB1C038499FB9B52A3544D20728.description: Examine appropriate procedures to ensure food safety in the kitchen.

6A336E1AF91B4EA3803A923FE5071468.description: Research Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) standards that apply to a commercial kitchen.

96DD7C4AC25442ADBCD7E671EB47C850.description: Review the fire evacuation plan for the work area and building.

6CBA0668549F48C5A937AD442132DF0D.description: Examine procedures for preventing and dealing with commercial kitchen fires.

A907ADA8A39E4B6DB175F7315AD59008.description: Identify common causes of commercial kitchen fires.

4291ECB1DA394FD6A8D0BC5540BFB86D.description: Discuss the importance of reporting workplace incidents or injuries immediately and the proper procedure to do so.

7AE22889EFBA4E3FBCA807B9DC19466A.description: Practise safe and hygienic washing of dishes, tools and cookware, either manually or using a dishwasher.

0D58C00FB3C249CF877EAFE6166FEFD3.description: Practise safe and hygienic washing of dishes, tools and cookware, either manually or using a dishwasher.

85D347A05ADF4DD5BA445E59D3F9382D.description: Maintain a clean and sanitary work area, including surfaces (e.g., floors, walls and tables) tools and equipment.

88AA49A4ECB642D9B60DB6D3BE8796C5.description: Discuss practices to maintain a safe and sanitary kitchen, including prevention of pest infestation.

BB2757EFCDE64224AC680D61AA2532F2.description: Explain the importance of sanitation in a commercial kitchen.

AA5D8B0777C74A92AA9F9401AF9D906F.description: Demonstrate personal hygiene (e.g., hand washing and hair restraint) and safe dress (e.g., closed-toe shoes, apron and gloves) when working in a commercial kitchen.

21BBC5C0AB7E415887E7320B3CF8B41E.description: Describe ways to reduce and prevent injury to self and others from unsafe work acts or environments.

1579245160574C91A362A9BDBE585EE7.description: Identify industry standard personal protective equipment (PPE) such as safety goggles, gloves, footwear, masks, headwear and protective clothing.

FCDD30C6FA3945C492FA64BFEB763146.description: Discuss the hierarchy of controls as a system for preventing hazards and reducing risk of injury in the workplace, including: elimination - physically removing the hazard; substitution - replacing the hazard; engineering controls - isolating people from the hazard; administrative controls - changing the way people work; and, personal protective equipment - protecting workers with the use of personal protective equipment.

10797EE1A94641C09CB3C17196FD9A54.description: Research injuries (e.g., strained muscles, cuts and lacerations, slips, falls and pepper burns) common among workers in commercial kitchens.

CBC2CE21C89A464E956AD0E635F41BFF.description: Identify potential worker safety hazards in a commercial kitchen.

BCE85CE75E0E4B599740BFD25441AC2A.description: Explain the purpose of food safety standards and regulations, including the role of public health inspectors.

6ED32D66250E4E16A0384278E81768DC.description: Discuss the importance of safety in a commercial kitchen.

CD3E4990DF494B01BAA6828B6A86C06A.description: Apply kitchen safety and sanitation practices.

1CE1C3BB5C4C4A6AB66865CAAF1C4B22.description: Recognize and apply safe and fair work practices including freedom from violence, harassment and bullying.

42F4EA7C20614FD7AA7CD6F7098F2EA0.description: Describe the rights and responsibilities of employees and employers, including the right to refuse process.

C0E8C156440F4FFDBBB741161AD89529.description: Identify types of workplace harassment and related resolution procedures (e.g., provincial labour mediation and conciliation services).

57B7D5995DB140E488498366CD148E71.description: Identify common worker injuries reported within the food service industry.

FB47E66BDBBF4B1DA8961F14766C4F8D.description: Discuss working conditions and employment standards common to the food service industry.

B1E8851B68FD4D698F6BA10CB75B24C4.description: Research expectations for employee and employer professionalism in the food service industry.

F27D8DCA64494E7B814DF2D12837E301.description: Explore characteristics of professionalism including: respect for self, others and workspace; competence; confidentiality; responsibility; dedication to quality; pride in appearance and personal hygiene; positive attitude; team player; willingness to learn; appropriate and ethical behaviour; and effective communication skills.

2ACF98151CB743CA920850F06C3A58F5.description: Examine the importance of professionalism in the food service industry.

6EF7475768CD4B37B73F2EA9E3691ED2.description: Professionalism in the Food Service Industry (Core)

7414C5A88E9D4EFEBCFF778CC7E14A39.description: Describe how current food trends impact the food service industry.

0B242D5F64444BD896BEBCE64F3EEA57.description: Examine cultural, economic, technological, social and environmental factors that influence the food service industry in Saskatchewan.

7C5BC3013C944B948F58544F67D23E10.description: Discuss the role of the food service industry in the community.

D24F920BA04F48DE923FC2358D2FDCB0.description: Identify the types of establishments (e.g., institutional kitchens, work camps, hotels, hospitals, bakeries, home-based and mobile food vendors) related to employment opportunities in the food service industry.

1BCBF3CB34704FD985198CBC421372ED.description: Examine how innovative technologies (e.g., food preservation and storage techniques), consumer concerns (e.g., food safety and nutrition) and new foods (e.g., convenience foods) influence the modern food service industry.

6BB0ACFDDFD04C8BA5DCE73E1233A7AE.description: Research the effects of technological developments (e.g., tools, electricity, electronics and computers) on the food service industry.

8CBFD0A4666345FC854B8241418AD38E.description: Identify the duties of common back-of-the-house (e.g., executive chef, sous chef, station chef and line cook) and front-of-the-house (e.g., maitre d’, server and food runner) roles in food service operations.

18BB096BE81B49BEB1552B898AF1F4FC.description: Differentiate between a classic kitchen brigade system (e.g., chef de cuisine, chef de partie, saucier, garde-manger and pâtissier) and a modern (e.g., executive chef, sous-chef, line cook and pastry chef) kitchen brigade.

8EAD8BC5AB1F42A9B5655F3F6D8C71D9.description: Examine how current food service industry terminology is based on terminology (e.g., sous chef) and practices (e.g., brigade system) used at the time of the French Revolution.

E64B47F6FE47477683FB5F7DD4E3F0C9.description: Discuss historical (e.g., King Henry IV, Antonin Carême and Auguste Escoffier) and contemporary (e.g., food network, convenience food, food blogs and fast food) influences on the food service industry.

DAC301A2A94B479593957135B967FAB6.description: Discuss the circumstances that led to the creation of the food service industry at the time of the French Revolution.

5A585B64066A48FD9691E7E38582BA18.description: Examine historical influences on the modern food service industry.
